alert.note: Alert for Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 8:12AM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Little Washita River near Ninnekah affecting Grady County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC051-060115- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.Y.0007.220505T1312Z-220506T1200Z/ /NKHO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 812 AM CDT Thu May 5 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Little Washita River near Ninnekah. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Near bankfull levels occur along the river in Grady County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The Little Washita River is expected to rise to a crest of 18.7 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
